summary: Email chain between attorney Teri Gibbs and federal prosecutors regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004. The emails discuss logistics for an in-person meeting and a video conference, and mention the provision of photographs for identification.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Primary correspondent arranging interviews for two clients who allege assault by Jeffrey Epstein. Coordinates scheduling and logistics with prosecutors.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: CC'd on emails to help coordinate travel arrangements for a victim and discuss victim services like counseling.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney who will accompany one of the victims to her in-person interview with prosecutors.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: CC'd on the initial email from Teri Gibbs regarding the victim reports.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). Two clients allege they were assaulted by him in or around June 2004.

connections.description: Both are attorneys working together to represent victims; Fudali is described as the New York attorney who will accompany a client.
Gibbs coordinates with Mullen regarding victim travel arrangements and potential victim services.
Both are attorneys copied on the initial confidential email regarding victim reports.
Gibbs is representing clients who are alleged victims of Epstein.
Fudali, as part of the victims' legal team, is involved in the case against Epstein.

events.title: Alleged assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview (in-person)
events.description: Scheduled meeting at 12 p.m. (later changed to 10:30 a.m.) between prosecutors and one alleged victim, accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview (video conference)
events.description: Scheduled video conference at 5 p.m. EST/2 p.m. PST with a second alleged victim who is located in Japan. Planned to use Skype.

events.title: Initial firm contact with prosecutors
events.description: Teri Gibbs' firm spoke with the U.S. Attorney's office regarding their clients' allegations against Epstein.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are identified, with assaults alleged to have occurred around June 2004.
The victims' attorneys provided photographs from 2004 to prosecutors and asked if their clients appeared in photos seized from Epstein's home.
One victim was scheduled for an in-person interview in New York on August 26, 2019, and the other for a video conference from Japan on August 27, 2019.
The correspondence shows coordination between victim attorneys, the U.S. Attorney's Office, and FBI victim services regarding interviews and support.
The case referenced is U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), indicating this was part of the 2019 federal prosecution.
